text: Hi, I just saw your message. I didn't have any notifications either, although I know they are on. Could you recommend me any good resources or tutorials to learn more simulations. Also I would like to start and learn Houdini (which we don't learn at Uni). I know some companies are asking for Houdini too. And I want to find some good tutorials for that too. How is it where you work? Does an FX TD need to know Maya and Houdini or just Maya? Thank you. PS: I will ask you about my project in a few days.

I will definitely recommend learning Houdini of your want to get into simulations. It is the industry standard now.

The sidefx YouTube channel is a very good place to start. They have a good collection of tutorials covering all levels of proficiency.

You can subscribe to Allan McKay's videos as well. He does good simulation tutorials from time to time.

Apart from that, Todd Palamar is a good person to look for. He has a few good destruction sims on Pluralsight.

Fxphd is a very good source of directed learning if you're looking to start somewhere. LinkedIn learning (<http://Lynda.com|Lynda.com>) also has good Houdini courses.

Hope that gets you started on sims. Please reach out of I can be of any help! Stay safe!
